noun.description: (especially in a work of literature) an effect of anticlimax created by an unintentional lapse in mood from the sublime to the trivial or ridiculous.
examples: his epic poem has passages of almost embarrassing bathos
a nice balance between the colloquial, which might have led to bathos, and an over-polished style

origin: Mid 17th century (first recorded in the Greek sense): from Greek, literally depth. The current sense was introduced by Alexander Pope in the early 18th century.
